trial_identification.studytitle: Topical capsaicin in burning mouth syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The efficacy of topical capsaicin in reducing symptoms in patients with burning mouth syndrome

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Patients will be instructed to apply topical capsaicin 0.075%, twice a day (middle morning and middle afternoon) for 8 weeks with a one-week interval - the fourth.
interventions.comparator: The control group received placebo - the water based cream utilized as vehicle for the capsaicin, twice a day, 4 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: relief of symptoms assessed through a visual analogue scale and a questionnaire of an overall effect perceived
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 weeks after starting medication or placebo, 8 weeks at the ending of drug administration and 12 weeks, four weeks after drug discontinuation.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: lasting of the benefits achieved - relief of symptoms, measured through visual analogue scale and a questionnaire of an overall effect perceived
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: six months after discontinuation of drug treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: burning mouth syndrome, no recent use of other drugs
